results.title: The Blowfly menace
results.creator_credit: A. C. McKay BVSc and Australian Wool Corporation
results.brief_description: For farmers and graziers this study of the life-cycle of the green blowfly and other flies associated with blowfly strike in sheep, and demonstrations of various methods of control, should prove both useful and interesting.
results.creator_credit_for_label: A. C. McKay BVSc and Australian Wool Corporation

results.title: Beyond LSD: a film for concerned adults and teenagers
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford, Paul Burnford Film Productions and Film Associates

video_links.name: Beyond LSD: a film for concerned adults and teenagers

results.brief_description: This 1960’s film is about the communication gap between two generations: teenagers and young adults on the one hand, and the generation of those over thirty - “the establishment”. The teenagers’ use of LSD and other drugs is only one of the symptoms of this communication gap. A group of parents desperately seek help in order to understand what has gone wrong. The film is an attempt to go “beyond LSD” and is intended to stimulate discussion amongst high school students, college students, teachers and parents. Ample involuntary hilarity can result from viewing this great hysterical/historical document. Starting as a raucous celluloid freak-out, the film presents its square’s-eye view of the “Generation Gap” through the fictive device of a round table of pod people, each alike in their helmet-hair and cat’s eye glasses. The production crew of this film was primarily made up of teenagers and young adults. Music by ‘The Stayns.’ A minor masterpiece of psychedelic cinema.
results.title_for_label: Beyond LSD: a film for concerned adults and teenagers

results.title: Begonia festival
results.creator_credit: David Corke, State Film Centre of Victoria and Boolari Films
results.brief_description: At the annual Begonia Festival, Ballarat becomes a city of flowers, music, dancing and drama centred on the famous begonia display. Mr. Tom Beaumont, the curator of the glass house in the Botanic Gardens, tends the many blooms. He is a world authority on begonia culture. Highlights of the display are a thousand double blooms and six hundred distinctive single varieties. In the gardens we see a fine display of salvias, gladioli and dahlias. Young and old admire the wonderful colour and variety of the Botanic Gardens and also the open air art exhibition. Commentary by John Morgan.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Corke, State Film Centre of Victoria and Boolari Films

results.title: Begone dull care
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren, Evelyn Lambart and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A lively interpretation of jazz music played by the Oscar Peterson Trio. The music is visually represented in a series of abstract lines and shapes, hand painted directly on to the film, culminating in a fast and furious explosion as the tempo quickens. One of the high points of jazz in cinema (and of McLaren’s career).

results.title: Before production begins
results.brief_description: The story of the birth of a new Holden car, from an artist’s conception, through the modelling of small and full scale models, to the making of the first prototype model. From the hundreds of scale drawings, skilled craftsmen create by hand, the hundreds of engine and body components of the prototype. Laboratory and road tests of components and the completed prototype ensue that every section of the car conforms to rigid engineering specifications. Only after all this preliminary work can mass production begin on a new model Holden car.

results.title: Living Hawthorn
results.creator_credit: Millard Johnson, William Alfred Gibson and Linda Johnson Gibson
results.brief_description: Shows a variety of street scenes in Hawthorn, Victoria, in the early 20th century including shots of Burwood Road, Glenferrie Station, local shops and businesses, traders and residents. Of historical and heritage value. Cinematography by Millard Johnson.

results.title: Hello, Mr. Webb!
results.brief_description: Film made by the Department of Agriculture’s film unit to promote itself by showing who they are, where they are located and what they do on a daily basis. The tone of the piece is very light and it contains numerous jokes relating to the fact that it is the film unit making a film about the film unit. Also contains general information about film editing machines (Moviola) and how they operate. Brief footage of the Spring St end of Bourke street circa 1977.

results.title: [Kodak Cinegraph compilation. No. 08]
results.brief_description: A compilation of newsreel segments focusing on Australia. 1. ‘[Royal Melbourne Zoo]’ shows a family strolling through the zoo. 2. ‘[Nar Nar Goon Airport]’ 3. ‘Turtle Island’ includes footage of giant turtles on the beach, men riding the turtles in a light-hearted race, and a dead turtle being cut open to show its heart which continues to beat 48 hours after death. 4. ‘[Peach growing in Australia]’ captures Australia’s fruit growing and canning industry in the 30’s showing the orchards, the sorting and inspection area, women peeling and removing stones, and the mechanised canning and processing sections.

results.title: [Kodak Cinegraph compilation. No. 12]
results.creator_credit: Kodak Cinegraph and Commonwealth Government of Australia
results.brief_description: A compilation of short newsreel segments. 1. ‘Where traffic is all wet’ captures the hustle and bustle of Shanghai harbour, followed by a Japanese harbour showing a ferry designed to take boats overland and a water tunnel. 2. ‘Glimpses of Australia’ takes a look at seals and penguins on Lady Julia Percy Island located 200 miles from Melbourne. 3. ‘A Glimpse of Canberra’ produced by the Development and Migration Commision visits parliament House. 4. ‘[Melbourne Zoo] shows Jimmy the champanzee, ostriches, tigers, lions, leopards, bears and a novelty segment showing a Mr Wilkie tugging at the tail of an accommodating tiger.
